Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); black and white and color, silent; 35:00
Abstract#1: A collection of short films and footage from the history of the Agfa-Ansco/General Aniline and Film (GAE) company in Binghamton, New York. Includes a short tilted, "Shipley Massingham Day at Agfa Ansco, Sept. 14, 1929: or the visit of Iliff Jones and his troupe of quota smashers," featuring a group of men arriving by train and walking through the Charles Street factory complex, as well as a scene of men running through a field intended to "demonstrate the slow motion taking feature of the new amateur Ansco cine camera." Reel also includes "Quest for Water," footage of drilling and installing the Agfa water tower in 1935; many images of company employees working in chemistry development labs, in offices, and with large equipment; test footage of "High Speed 16mm Films" and "Super Anscochrome Tungsten," featuring sports footage and behind the scenes shots of Ansco models; news headlines about Ansco products; images of sales meetings from airline flights to presentations to dinner meetings; and recreation footage from the Agfa Ansco Athletic Association from the 1940s and '50s, including bike riding, family picnics, swimming at Agfa Lake, baseball games, performances, and Santa Claus greeting children.
Physical Location#1: University of Colorado Boulder. Special Collections, Archives & Preservation
Access Condition#1: This Item is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use this Item in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

Current; performers, Lenoard Cahoon, George Burnham, Howard B. Groff; director, R. Fate; titles, R. Courante. Fiction film set at Almagre Mountain in Colorado Springs, including mountain views, gold prospectors, and skiing.

Title#1: A simple, safe method of cholecystectomy, abridged
Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); color, sound (magnetic); 6:46
Abstract#1: Photographer, Ira B. Current. A film about gall bladder surgery featuring illustrated drawings and close-up footage of surgery conducted by Dr. Hyman Sneierson and Dr. John Cunningham of Binghamton, New York. Actual camera exposure: Cine Kodak Special at 24 fps, 1/50, f:8. Operating room castle lights - no supplemental lighting. 4-inch lens. Printed on Ansco Color Duplicating T-238."

Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); black-and-white, silent; 12:29
Abstract#1: Home movie footage of various Binghamton Camera Club meetings, in the homes of Boyd Elliot and John Forrest and at the American Legion building. Men gather in living rooms to project slides and moving image film, examine photo prints and negatives, and discuss various camera equipment and accessories, with women preparing snacks in the kitchen.
Note#1: 00:00 Camera quickly switchs between close-up shots of various members at the Camera Club meeting. The members continue to talk and drink.; 01:01 A man turns the light out where the members are meeting and then scenes follow of different members examining photographic negatives and slides on a small light table, or light box. The group also looks at large format prints.; 02:04 The Camera Club members gather around rows of white tables and look at photographic slides from a projector. The images depict people at a lake. They continue to talk around the white tables and examine slides on the light box.; 04:39 A man sets up a projector with film reels on it. While the projector is being set up, the men continue to talk around tables with different types of cameras placed on the tables.; 06:45 The Camera Club members are outside and talking in somone's yard.; 07:03 The camera switches between close-up shots of members talking indoors. A wife of one of the members then joins the group.; 07:55 Photographic slides are shown from a projector. The slides depict scenes of various people in their daily lives, horses and flowers.; 08:29 The group members talk and look at large format prints.; 09:34 The film seems to switch to footage of the Camera Club meeting in a new home, or location. They talk and prepare a projector with slides.; 11:08 Presumably wives of the Camera Club members are gathered in the kitchen. The women cut cakes and pies and hand plates of dessert out to the men.; 12:14 A man sits at an organ or piano and plays music while members of the club sit around him and watch.
Subject Geographic#1: Binghamton (Broome, New York, United States, North America) (populated place)
Physical Location#1: University of Colorado Boulder. Special Collections, Archives & Preservation

Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); color, silent; 42:52
Abstract#1: A Gateway Picture; photographer, Ira B. Current. Notes from container include: "Chenango Valley; Port Dover, Ontario; Greenfield Village; Hayes State Park; Lincoln Country; Lake of the Ozarks; Dodge City; Colorado Spings; Sand Dunes National Monument; Royal Gorge; Garfield camp; Upper Gunnison; 4J camp, Ouray; jeep trip to Engineer Mountain; Million Dollar Highway; Mesa Verde National Park; Bandelier; Cimarron, New Mexico; Cimarron, Kansas; Pomme de Terre; Hickory Haven." Hand-edited home movie footage with intertitles, including Current family loading and unloading station wagon, setting up camp, and cooking in multiple locations. Images include Greenfield Village, Michigan, with riverboat; historic log cabins in New Salem, Illinois; swimming at the Lake of the Ozarks and Pomme de Terre reservoir; extended Current family at the home of Park and Anna Current in Canon City, Colorado; Colorado and New Mexico landscape and landmark views; and a scenic jeep tour through a ghost town.

Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); black-and-white and color, silent; 12:24
Abstract#1: Notes from container include: "Last of Phoebe Snow, 60-66." Reel contains footage of the passanger train, Phoebe Snow, on the Erie Lackawanna Railway, as well as a steam train in the mountains and a model train circling a toy station. Also includes footage inside a passenger jet and aerial views of farmland.
Note#1: 00:00 Men load the passenger train called "Phoebe Snow" as it gets ready to depart on the Erie Lackawanna Railway. The film continues to show other trains on the railway and the surrounding area.; 02:22 Clouds are seen from an aircraft cabin window. There is also several shots of people seated within the interior of the aircraft cabin. Eventually passengers exit the plane and walk towards the terminal.; 04:12 A train arrives at a station with snow on the tracks and people exit the station.; 05:24 A train passes by a railroad crossing at night. People walk around the train station in the dark.; 06:16 Color footage of a city from a train window.; 06:49 A small locomotive train travels along a narrow mountain cliff.; 07:22 A model passenger train with "Santa Fe" painted on the front of the engine rides around a model train track.; 08:46 Color footage from an aircraft cabin window shows fields and neighborhoods as the plane makes it descent. Cars are parked outside the airport.; 09:20 The film switches to black-and-white footage of a man and woman standing next to a train engine. The Arcade and Attica train carries passengers along the tracks.; 10:38 Film switches back to color footage of people walking around the tracks of a railroad depot.; 11:05 A plane is flying in the air.; 11:17 Several iris shots are used to transition between various scenes such as a railroad crossing signal, train running on the tracks, and freight cars.

Title#1: Current review no. 770: The trailer[er] to Colorado
Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); color, silent; 33:59
Abstract#1: Home movie footage of the Current family trip to Colorado, 1970. Includes a visit to Ira's brother, Richard Current, at Lake Denton, Wisconsin, including an A-frame cabin and pontoon boating; the Circus World Museum in Baraboo, Wisconsin, in the Wisconsin Dells, including circus wagons, posters, Ringling Bros. train, elephant, steam caliope, and circus performers under a big top; the Current family's ancestral cemetery outside Maquoteka, Iowa; the home of Ira Current's sister, Irma Hilfers, in Colorado Springs; the home of Ira Current's parents, Park and Anna Current, outside Canon City, Colorado; Phantom Canyon and Cripple Creek, Colorado; the buildings and grounds of the Air Force Academy; the opera house and downtown of Central City, Colorado; Monarch Pass; a mountain gondola and small steam engine, as well as driving and camping scenes and numerous Colorado landscapes.

Title#1: Current review no. 9: Presenting Kenney Buck in "Buck Kenney Grows Up"
Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); black and white, silent; 20:00
Abstract#1: Photographer, Norma Semter and Ira Current. Reel contains a collection of home movie clips from the 1930s featuring a young boy, presumably the son of Norma Semter. Scenes include a baby crawling in a living room and playing with buttons on a radio; mother and father leaving the house with the baby and lots of baby supplies; using a swing and eating ice cream with the father on a beach; using a tricycle on a snowy street while a man takes photos; with his mother by a lake; and playing outside in a field. An extended sequence titled "Wolfe' goes for an airing" shows the boy and his parents walking a small puppy on a leash on a snow street. Reel also includes a sequence titled "A quiet evening with Norma Semter, Pearl Swart, and Gertrude Kornbeck" where women sit in a living room, chatting, writing letters, and reading books and magazines. Reel shot at 16 fps.

Title#1: Current review: Colorado newsreel no. 162: A weekend in Colorado
Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); color, silent; 9:26
Abstract#1: Home movie footage of the Current family, with intertitles. Images include a snowy swimming pool and hotel room; footage of Park and Anna Current in their Canon City home, gardening, sewing, and woodworking; and Colorado landscape views from the Denver and Rio Grande railroad to Colorado Springs. Also includes the apartment of Ira Current's sister Grace, including children playing trumpet and piano, and the family showing off the door to the "new fallout shelter" in the backyard.

Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); black-and-white and color, silent; 12:50
Abstract#1: Notes from container include: "Visit of RPI [Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute] Choir to Elmira, 3/68. Departing for Troy on bus, 4/69. Department for Troy in new Valiant, 11/69. Parents week-end, Troy, 5/66. Sitting at picnic table, 8/68. Greasing Valiant, 3/71, and Ellen picking up yard." Reel contains home movie footage of Current family packing musical instruments into a car; singers, audience, and percussionists at choir concert; Michael Current leaving for college by car and bus; Ellen Current cutting Michael's hair; campus buildings and parents weekend garden presentation at RPI in Troy, New York; and Michael working under a Valiant car.
Note#1: 00:00 Current family packs musical instruments and other belongings into a car and drives away from the house; 01:36 Film cuts to a scene of young men and women playing instruments and singing in a choir. The men and women are possibly students in the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute choir class.; 02:37  A bus is parked outside with students packing the bus with their instruments. The film continues to show the bus driving around.; 03:53 Film cuts to a black-and-white scene of the Current family packing a car and Michael Current backing the car out of the driveway as he leaves for college.; 05:16 Ellen Current is cutting Michael's hair.; 05:41 Ellen Current, as well as Michael Current and other people, walking towards a cherry tree and talking. The group attends various events such as an indoor film screening and outdoor choir presentation in a garden for parent's weekend at the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute.; 10:45 Michael Current is sitting at a picnic table and playing with a hammer.; 11:20 Film cuts to a scene of Michael Current working underneath a Valiant car for maintenace work. Ellen Current walks by the vehicle to pick something up off of the ground and continues to walk inside the house.

Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); black-and-white and color, silent; 11:43
Abstract#1: Hand-edited images of Ira Current's home workshop and camera equipment projects, with chalkboard, film trims, technical sketches, and small electronic and camera/projector parts. Equipment may have been created for a Smithsonian exhibit on film developing.
Note#1: 00:20 Close-up of a woman, possibly Ellen Current, sitting in chair next to a table lamp.; 00:33 The camera pans around a workshop area and shows camera equipment, stacks of paper, and a chalkboard.; 01:13 A new interior room is shown and the camera pans from a painting on the wall to a desk with a lamp and stacked books.; 01:27 Rows of film strips hang from screws in the wall.; 01:37 A close up of various technical drawings and a chalkboard is shown.; 02:24 A pair of hands works on components of electrical equipment such as soldering wires to a circuit board and trimming the wire with pliers.; 03:11 A close up of various machine parts are activated. There is a young boy examining the machine.; 04:57 The same young boy is now sitting on the floor and applying paint to a large box or container. As the boy paints, the camera pans back and forth towards the machine the boy was looking at earlier.; 05:43 Film cuts to a scene in color of a man loading a machine with a single film negative.; 08:57 Close up of a different machine is shown. This machine might be activated for the process of developing film strips.
Subject Geographic#1: [Binghamton (Broome, New York, United States, North America) (populated place)]

Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); color, silent; 10:41
Abstract#1: A Gateway Picture; photographer, Ira B. Current. Title on leader: "Rough Colorado." Hand-edited film includes footage of the National Association of Photo-Lithographers' 27th annual convention in Kansas City, Missouri, including images of city landmarks and festival attendees, as well as views from the Current's airplane travel. Also includes images of the Missouri Pacific Lines Eagle train, station, and window views; and the home of Ira Current's parents, Park and Anna Current, in Canon City, Colorado, with Canon City area buildings, neighborhoods, cemetery, downtown decorated for Christmas, and desert landscapes. Finally, a family gathering at the home of one of Ira Current's sisters, where young girls play with a cardboard doll house. Reel 504 contains outtakes from this film, including additional footage around the Current family home, Colorado landscapes, the Rio Grande train, and title cards.
Physical Location#1: University of Colorado Boulder. Special Collections, Archives & Preservation

Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); color, silent; 10:00
Abstract#1: This film was made to demonstrate the use of Anscochrome color film stock in natural situations, as shot with available light. Scenes include children reading by a fireplace and oil lamp; an image of the moon shot through a telescope; scenes of night driving and downtown Johnson City, New York; indoor shots of a department store, pharmacy, and lunch counter; a stage play inside the Riviera Strand theater in Binghamton, New York; a nighttime baseball game; amusement park rides, a carousel, and concession stands; performers in a circus tent; and fireworks.

Extent#1: 1 film reel (16mm); color, silent, acetate; 12:00
Abstract#1: Reel contains home movie footage of Ellen Current and the Current children. Scenes include a trip to beach, a picnic at a lake house with older relatives, the children on bikes and hula-hooping in the driveway, Susan using a camera on a wooden tripod to photograph the family in the yard, and the boys building and using a large telescope. Reel also includes a Thanksgiving road trip to visit relatives, with images of rest stops, table settings, a woman cooking in a kitchen, young cousins, and a football game on television.
